item.title: Microsoft PowerToys will launch and automatically arrange your favorite apps
item.description:
Microsoft is working on a new Workspaces features for its PowerToys suite of Windows add-ons that will launch a collection of apps and automatically arrange and snap them into a custom layout on your monitor.

PowerToys Workspaces will let you create app layouts that can be saved to a shortcut that you use to automatically launch all your apps and place them on your screens. It supports multiple monitors, and you can create multiple app layouts for different tasks.

“The goal of app layouts is really to allow you as a developer to get into your workspaces and your workflows easier with just one click, and get your desktop all set up with just one...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Tom Warren

item.title: Ashok Leyland organises ‘Mini Expo’ in Mumbai to showcase advanced MHCV innovations
item.description: The event emphasizes Ashok Leyland’s state-of-the-art MHCV products and vehicles. It is targeted at industry professionals, enthusiasts, and stakeholders keen on the latest advancements in MHCV technology.

item.title: Australia, US look to joint production of hypersonic missile, US lawmaker says
item.description: Australia and the US discussed joint production of hypersonic missiles to alleviate strain on American defence resources and enhance deterrence in the Indo-Pacific. The initiative aims to counteract China's advancements in hypersonic technology. The AUKUS alliance will facilitate advanced defence collaborations, including nuclear-powered submarines, heightening regional security measures and deterring Chinese aggression in the South China Sea.

item.title: Pakistan govt admits tinkering with internet: Report
item.description: The Pakistan government confirmed upgrading its web management system to address cyber security threats, amidst ongoing internet disruptions. Millions faced connectivity issues, primarily with mobile data. Minister Shaza Fatima Khawaja emphasized the necessity of these measures for protection against cyber attacks. The disruptions led to a petition in Lahore High Court seeking immediate restoration of internet access.
